page.title: 08WORLINGTON SCHOOL BUILDINGS
page.content: The school house is very old.It used to be a church house.It was rented by the church from Lord Portsmouth and was used for a meeting and drinking place.It then became a poor house. In 1800 it was rebuilt for Â£60.In 1855 Lord Portsmouth let it for a school. School was upstairs and the poor were downstairs.In 1868 the National School was built.This is now the junior room. In 1874 a School Board was formed to build on another room for infants.We use this as part of the junior classroom now.In 1952 the kitchen was added on.In 1968 the infants moved into a new wooden classroom.The Head lived in the school house until 1980.Since then it has been used as part of the school facilities.It is a Grade II Listed Building.
